name: Seraphim (Burning Ones)

archetype.name:
Jewish Roots & Parallels

Prophet Isaiah - The seraphim vision
Merkavah Mysticism - Throne visions in Judaism
Cherubim - Companion throne guardians
Kedusha Prayer - "Holy, Holy, Holy" in Jewish liturgy

content:
# Seraphim (Burning Ones)

## Abilities and Powers

- Name Meaning: "Burning Ones" or "Fiery Ones" (Hebrew: 砖职专指驻执)
- Rank: Highest choir in the celestial hierarchy
- Appearance: Six wings, human-like form, radiant with divine fire
- Function: Perpetual worship, guardians of God's throne, agents of purification
- Characteristics: Burning love for God, holiness, worship
- Song: "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts"
- vs. Cherubim: Seraphim emphasize love and worship; cherubim emphasize knowledge and guarding
- vs. Archangels: Seraphim remain at God's throne; archangels are sent on missions to humanity
- vs. Regular Angels: Seraphim are of a higher, more glorious order, closer to God

## Archetypal Significance

vs. Regular Angels: Seraphim are of a higher, more glorious order, closer to God
